definition: to tweak one's ears and scratch one's cheeks (as an expression of anxiety, delight, frustration etc) (idiom)
to grab/to catch/to arrest/to snatch/to scratch
ear/handle (archaeology)/and that is all (Classical Chinese)
to scratch/to thwart/to yield
cheek

sentences.english: It means to scratch your head in order to help you remember something you’ve forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着你抓耳撓腮以使自己想起你遺忘的東西。

sentences.english: Actually he’s been sitting in front of his new Mac scratching his head for three YEARS now.
sentences.chinese: 事實上他已經坐在他嶄新的電腦面前抓耳撓腮三年了。

definition: lit. the soul flies away and scatters (idiom)/fig. to be frightened stiff/spooked out of one's mind/terror-stricken
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
overjoyed (idiom); as pleased as punch
lit. shocks the eye, astonishes the heart (idiom); shocking/horrible to see/a ghastly sight/also written 觸目驚心|触目惊心
fiends (idiom); devils and monsters
not recognizing one's family (idiom); self-centered and not making any allowances for the needs of one's relatives
vivid and colorful (idiom); true to life/lively and realistic
to inquire
crafty plots and machinations (idiom)
not to glance sideways (idiom)/to gaze fixedly/to be fully concentrated/to preserve a correct attitude
doddering/senile
to walk right into the trap
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to swallow clouds and blow out fog (idiom)/to blow cigarette or opium smoke
